output_list.reason: The mintToken function does not have a check on the overflow of the total supply, allowing the owner to mint arbitrary amounts of tokens to any user account, causing a buy price to become 0 and allowing the owner to drain funds.
The _transfer function does not check if the target address is a smart contract, allowing a transfer to a smart contract address to fail, wasting funds.

The sell function does not have a check on the overflow of the amount to be sold, allowing an attacker to call sell with a large amount, causing a buy price to become 0 and allowing the attacker to drain funds.
The approveAndCall function does not check the spender address, allowing a spender to be set to a contract that can be exploited to steal funds.
The selfdestructs function is payable and accessible to anyone, allowing any user to transfer the owner's funds to any address, causing a buy price to become 0 and allowing the user to drain funds.
